item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18893)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @homelessoutloud was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=homelessoutloud&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Some phots from last nights Civil Rights Awards Banquet ... ...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Some phots from last nights Civil Rights Awards Banquet ... Have some video coming out soon of the statements made. And of the sweep of these folks who will be swept tomorrow morning. Imagine doing a public speaking event and then having to negotiate getting swept the next morning.

item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: The victims of that "increase in crime" he describes...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The victims of that "increase in crime" he describes are those in the encampments. His reason for making that statement and leaving that information out is to help "manufacture consent" from the housed community so they can send their sanctioned vigilante mobs out to hassle the encampments.

Remember the eviction moratorium just passed. There are so many more people coming to the streets. Ticketing them for being poor will not help us.

https://kdvr.com/…/denver-to-launch-civilian-camping-ban-e…/

In less than a month, Denver expects to deploy a team of civilians to enforce the city’s camping ban.

kdvr.com

Denver to launch civilian camping ban enforcement team

In less than a month, Denver expects to deploy a team of civilians to enforce the city’s camping ban.In less than a month, Denver expects to deploy a team of civilians to enforce the city’s camping ban.

item.title: SWEEPS week of 9/20-9/24/21 SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 9/21...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS week of 9/20-9/24/21
SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 9/21 at E. 23rd Avenue to the North, N. Clarkson Street to the East, E. 20th Avenue to the South, Park Avenue West to the Southwest, and Court Place to the Northwest; Wednesday 9/22 at Arkins Court to the Northwest, 31st Street to the Northeast, Brighton Blvd / N. Broadway to the Southeast, Wewatta Street to the South, and Denargo Street to the West Thursday 9/23 at E. 17th Avenue to the North, N. Marion Street to th...e East, E. Colfax Avenue to the South, and N. Ogden Street to the West. This is the immaculate encampment outside of DHOL offices that have all public health concerns mitigated by the organization in the building.
The SWEEPS will begin each day at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/Cocoa
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Your advocacy is much appreciated!
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS this week began on Wednesday 9/15 at 10th and Clarkson....
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS this week began on Wednesday 9/15 at 10th and Clarkson. First sweep after renewing EHS contract. EHS crew arrive blasting the song LOSER. Once it ended, They played it blasting again. Three residents stated that they were harassed by EHS workers who made statements of "if you would get your shit together I wouldn;t be sent out here to clean up all your trash." Ana and Virya reported this to Officer Farris.
SWEEPS continued on Thursday 9/16 at the Central Library. About... 5 people from a group called "Citizens for a Safe and Clean Denver" showed up and placed signs on the fencing complaining about drug use and calling for folks to be moved into shelters (the least preferred or safe option). Councilman Chris Hinds was there talking with that group, officer Connover, and Ralph. Fencing spanned from 14th to Colfax and Broadway to Bannock.
SWEEPS were scheduled to continue on Friday 9/17 again at the Central Library. No residents returned to the area overnight. There were two state troopers parked on 13th and Lincoln and a DPD squad car at 14th and Bannock.
SWEEPING people does not work. Homelesness is only solved by HOUSING. Until we have the housing for people to move into, we must stop this nonsensical and expensive whack-a-mole non solution. We march onward towards Rights, Dignity, Housing....

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: "Data analysis from Denverite shows that encampment sweeps,...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Data analysis from Denverite shows that encampment sweeps, which often include temporary fencing measures, followed by permanent hostile architecture, are growing in number in Capitol Hill and Civic Center Park."
---
Rocks on the ground where people sleep are not going to house them.

https://www.msmayhem.com/the-rise-of-anti-homeless-hostile…/

The rise of "anti-homeless" hostile architecture and encampment sweeps across Denver is alarming to advocates, who say it's worsening the issue.

msmayhem.com

The rise of "anti-homeless" hostile architecture in Denver

item.title: Unwilling to hold contractors accountable - your city council...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Unwilling to hold contractors accountable - your city council will likely approve these Bozo's for 2 more years worth of mischief.

EHS will cost the city plenty as they continue to violate the Cities settlement agreement with the homeless. The federal case against the city is growing in no small part to the inept effort of EHS.

Come and complain if you want but their votes for measures like this were purchased long ago. Yep... purchased.

...

item.title: SWEEPS next week are on Thursday and Friday from 12th to 14th...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS next week are on Thursday and Friday from 12th to 14th and Lincoln to Cherokee.
The SWEEP on Tuesday/Wednesday was cancelled due to inaccurate dates on the posting.
The SWEEPS will begin each day at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/Cocoa
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Your advocacy is much appreciated!
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 9/7 at 22nd and Champa and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 9/7 at 22nd and Champa and Stout and the alley between California and Stout on 22nd. Approximately 60 people were traumatically displaced. One person was given a hotel voucher

SWEEPS continued on Wednesday 9/8 at Park Ave, Broadway, and Welton. Another 25 people were traumatically displaced. No one was offered motel vouchers at this camp.

SWEEPS did not happen on 9/9, as everyone had already been swept on Tuesday and Wednesday.

...

SWEEPING people does not work. Homelesness is only solved by HOUSING. Until we have the housing for people to move into, we must stop this nonsensical and expensive whack-a-mole non solution. We march onward towards Rights, Dignity, Housing....
Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org

item.title: Spending the money on everything but housing. EHS is not the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Spending the money on everything but housing. EHS is not the only contract up for a vote. Most of our shelters are private institutions. (i.e Denver Rescue Mission or the Salvation Army). Some of their funding comes from the Gov't but why is the city paying directly for security instead of these private institutions paying for their own security?

https://original.newsbreak.com/…/2366613557494-millions-spe…

The City of Denver will vote Monday whether to extend a contract with Veritas Security by $2.9 million for a total $10.4 million to keep Denver’s homeless shelters safe. The contract extends Veritas' services to the end of the year.

original.newsbreak.com

Security costs $10.4 million at Denver homeless shelters | David Heitz | NewsBreak Original

The City of Denver will vote Monday whether to extend a contract with Veritas Security by $2.9 million for a total $10.4 million to keep Denver’s homeless shelters safe. The contract extends Veritas' services to the end of the year.The City of Denver will vote Monday whether to extend a contract with Veritas Security by $2.9 million for a total $10.4 million to keep Denver’s homeless shelters safe. The contract extends Veritas' services to the end of the year.

item.title: "Denver City Councilwoman Candi CDeBaca advanced a budget...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Denver City Councilwoman Candi CDeBaca advanced a budget measure that would have housed a thousand people permanently. She did not find support from her colleagues."
--
@DenCityCouncil
don't make the same mistake this year.

...

https://original.newsbreak.com/…/2366437565785-millions-spe…

See MoreA city crew sweeps an ecampment site in Denver.Denver Homeless Out Loud. Millions of dollars in city homeless expenditures that do nothing to permanently house people could be used to house most all the city’s homeless population, a local advocacy group says.

original.newsbreak.com

Millions spent on homeless issue could house them all, group says | David Heitz | NewsBreak Original

A city crew sweeps an ecampment site in Denver.Denver Homeless Out Loud. Millions of dollars in city homeless expenditures that do nothing to permanently house people could be used to house most all the city’s homeless population, a local advocacy group says.A city crew sweeps an ecampment site in Denver.Denver Homeless Out Loud. Millions of dollars in city homeless expenditures that do nothing to permanently house people could be used to house most all the city’s homeless population, a local advocacy group says.
